refnamediv.refpurpose: Creates a tone similar to a clarinet.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Audio output is a tone similar to a clarinet, using a physical model developed from Perry Cook, but re-coded for Csound.

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: ares wgclar kamp, kfreq, kstiff, \ iatt, idetk, kngain, kvibf, kvamp [, ifn] [, iminfreq]

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: iatt -- time in seconds to reach full blowing pressure. 0.1 seems to correspond to reasonable playing. A longer time gives a definite initial wind sound.
idetk -- time in seconds taken to stop blowing. 0.1 is a smooth ending
ifn (optional) -- table of shape of vibrato, defaults yo te usual sine table.
iminfreq (optional) -- lowest frequency at which the instrument will play. If it is omitted it is taken to be the same as the initial kfreq. If iminfreq is negative, initialization will be skipped.

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: A note is played on a clarinet-like instrument, with the arguments as below.
kstiff -- a stiffness parameter for the reed. Values should be negative, and about -0.3. The useful range is approximately -0.44 to -0.18.
kngain -- amplitude of the noise component, about 0 to 0.5
kvibf -- frequency of vibrato in Hertz. Suggested range is 0 to 12
